inputs.remark: 空白的 JSON（模型输出为空/缺失）。

logic_summary: Populated clinical data from OCR text.
Added differential diagnosis including facial paralysis and hearing loss.
Added investigations including CT, Audiometry, and ENoG details.
Added treatment plan focusing on surgery for left facial nerve.
Added escalation rationale based on ENoG findings.
Added follow-up and outcomes based on case report conclusion.

value: Bilateral facial nerve paralysis (HB Grade VI/VI)
Bilateral longitudinal temporal bone fractures
Conductive hearing loss (left ear) secondary to ossicular chain disruption
Sensorineural hearing loss (right ear, slight)
Computed Tomography (CT) scan
Electromyography (EMG)
Pure-tone audiometry
Speech audiometry (SAT)
Immittance audiometry (Tympanometry, Acoustic Reflexes)
Electroneuronography (ENoG)

interpretations: CT: Bilateral longitudinal temporal bone fractures traversing horizontal segment of facial nerve canal; small subarachnoid hemorrhage; pulmonary contusions.
Audiometry: Right ear slight hearing loss at 250 Hz, normal 500-8000 Hz. Left ear slight conductive loss 250-500 Hz, mild conductive loss 2000-8000 Hz with air-bone gaps.
Immittance: Normal tympanograms bilaterally (suggesting ossicular disruption rather than fluid); ARTs present ipsilateral right (100 dB HL), absent otherwise.
ENoG: Right side minimal response (58 µV); Left side absent response initially. Serial monitoring showed transient recovery on left, then disappearance (critical distress).

value: Prednisone (60 mg daily, initiated prior to audiology visit)
Serial ENoG monitoring (every 3-5 days)
Surgical decompression of the left facial nerve
Discuss ENoG findings indicating critical distress of left facial nerve
Recommend surgical intervention for left side
Monitor right facial nerve for spontaneous recovery
Discuss management of persistent conductive hearing loss (patient declined)
Bilateral facial nerve paralysis (HB Grade VI/VI)
Declining ENoG response on left side indicating nerve degeneration
Head trauma with temporal bone fractures

value.rationale_short: Left facial nerve showed declining response on serial ENoG, indicating critical distress and need for decompression.

value.objective: Monitor facial nerve function recovery and hearing status.

value: 1 week post-op: Upper brow and lip movement on left side.
2 months: Significant facial recovery (HB III/VI).
6 months: Full facial recovery (HB I/VI) bilaterally.
Persistent conductive hearing loss in left ear.
